titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I dined with Mr Parker & met Principal Rainy. He is a fine, masterful old Scotchman. He told me that the Presbyterians would not insist on re-ordaining a Congregationalist minister, who wished to join them. I took down Miss Isabella Dennistone [sic] to dinner, & found her a very charming companion.
